## Project Experiences ##

#### The Monkey Compiler  

A programming frame for a complete and fundamental functional language, aimed
at exploring the compiling techniques for functional languages. It will be capable of
generating code for mobiles.  

Techniques: CPS conversion, closure conversion, defunctionalization, garbage collec-
tion, etc.  

#### The Tiger Compiler  

An extensible compiling system for an object oriented language, for research purposes.  

Techniques: lexing, parsing, type checking, code generation garbage collection, opti-
mization, etc.  

#### Parallel Instructional Operating System (PIOS)  

A fundamental parallel operation system. The project is aimed at exploring the
structures and implementation of operating systems.  

Techniques: bootloader, memory management, process management, interrupt han-
dling, memory mapping, etc.  

#### Search Engine for Micro-Blog Information  

A search engine for micro-blog information, providing classi ed results based on text
contents.  

Responsibility: design and implementation of the automatic content-based classi ca-
tion algorithm.  

## Teaching Assistent Experiences

Writing lab code and documents, explanation, assignment reviewing, etc.  

Courses:  

1. _Compiler_, compiler theory and engineering;  

2. _Formal Methods Foundation_, basic concepts of formal methods, and their ap-
plications in computer science.  

3. _Advanced Topics in Softwares_, basics of functional language compilation.

## Awards ##
1. Excellent Student, School of Software Engineering, 2015  

2. Meritorious Winner, Mathematical Contest in Modeling, 2010
